intro.title: metagenome submission
intro.text: A metagenome submission requires a single or a set of sequence files in fasta or fastq format and a filled out metadata Excel spreadsheet. Sequence files can be demultiplexed before submission and you can join paired ends.

cmd.description: validate sequence and generate the workspace document for upload to the workspace
cmd.name: kb_validate_file_and_generate_ws_doc.pl

metadata.name: MicrobialCommunitiesMetagenome
metadata.label: Microbial Communities Metagenome
metadata.description: Microbial Communities metagenome submission metadata template

misc_param.description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

project_name.description: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

submitted_to_insdc.description: Depending on the study (large-scale e.g. done with next generation sequencing technology, or small-scale) sequences have to be submitted to SRA (Sequence Read Archive), DRA (DDBJ Read Archive) or via the classical Webin/Sequin systems to Genbank, ENA and DDBJ

project_description.description: Description of the project within which the sequencing was organized

feature.description: Environmental feature level includes geographic environmental features. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. EnvO terms listed under environmental feature can be found from the link: http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1069/?conceptid=ENVO%3A00002297

biotic_relationship.description: Is it free-living or in a host and if the latter what type of relationship is observed

source_mat_id.description: The name of the culture collection, holder of the voucher or an institution. Could enumerate a list of common resources, just as the American Type Culture Collection (ATCC), German Collection of Microorganisms and Cell Cultures (DSMZ) etc. Can select not deposited

collection_time.description: The local time of sampling.  Use ISO8601 compliant format, ie. 19:23:10

specific_host.description: If there is a host involved, please provide its taxid (or environmental if not actually isolated from the dead or alive host - i.e. pathogen could be isolated from a swipe of a bench etc) and report whether it is a laboratory or natural host). From this we can calculate any number of groupings of hosts (e.g. animal vs plant, all fish hosts, etc)

latitude.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The value should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

collection_timezone.description: The timezone of sampling.  Use ISO8601 compliant format, ie. UTC-7

samp_collect_device.description: The method or device employed for isolating/collecting the sample

temperature.description: Temperature of the sample in celsius at time of sampling

samp_size.description: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected, along with the unit used

longitude.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The value should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

location.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific local region name

depth.description: Depth is defined as the vertical distance in meters below surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectivly.

experimental_factor.description: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v132) terms, please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44641; for a browser of OBI (v1.0) terms please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/40832

trophic_level.description: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

continent.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by continent.  Use one of: Africa, Antarctica, Asia, Australia, Europe, North America, South America

host_spec_range.description: The NCBI taxonomy identifier of the specific host if it is known

num_replicons.description: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote

health_disease_stat.description: Health or disease status of specific host at time of collection. This field accepts PATO (v1.269) terms, for a browser please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44601

misc_param.description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

estimated_size.description: The estimated size of the genome prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period.

elevation.description: The elevation of the sampling site in meters as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

collection_date.description: The date of sampling. Use ISO8601 compliant format, ie. 2008-01-23

pathogenicity.description: To what is the entity pathogenic.

extrachrom_elements.description: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids)

encoded_traits.description: Should include key traits like antibiotic resistance or xenobiotic degradation phenotypes for plasmids, converting genes for phage

biome.description: The environmental biome represents the major classes of ecologically similar communities of plants, animals, and other organisms. Biomes are defined based on factors such as plant structures, leaf types, plant spacing, and other factors like climate. Examples include: desert, taiga, deciduous woodland, or coral reef. EnvO terms listed under environmental biome can be found from the link: http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1069/?conceptid=ENVO%3A00000428

sample_name.description: Unique name or id of the sample

propagation.description: This field is specific to different taxa. For phages: lytic/lysogenic, for plasmids: incompatibility group (Note: there is the strong opinion to name phage propagation obligately lytic or temperate, therefore we also give this choice

rel_to_oxygen.description: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments

subspecf_gen_lin.description: This should provide further information about the genetic distinctness of this lineage by recording additional information i.e biovar, serovar, serotype, biovar, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. It can also contain alternative taxonomic information

altitude.description: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance in meters between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

country.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1397)

samp_mat_process.description: Any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment. This field accepts OBI, for a browser of OBI (v1.0) terms please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/40832

ref_biomaterial.description: primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report

isol_growth_condt.description: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation of the sample

env_package.description: MIGS/MIMS/MIMARKS extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from one or more of the environments where the sample was obtained. Use one of: air, host-associated, human-associated, human-skin, human-oral, human-gut, human-vaginal, microbial mat|biofilm, miscellaneous, plant-associated, sediment, soil, wastewater|sludge, water

material.description: The environmental material level refers to the matter that was displaced by the sample, prior to the sampling event. Environmental matter terms are generally mass nouns. Examples include: air, soil, or water. EnvO terms listed under environmental matter can be found from the link: http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/1069/?conceptid=ENVO%3A00010483

forward_primer_final_conc.description: Forward primer final concentration in micromolar

pcr_clean_up_kits.description: One or more can be listed, but should be in corresponding order with clean_up_methods. Ex: MoBio UltraClean PCR Clean-Up Kit

seq_meth.description: Sequencing method used. Use one of: sanger, pyrosequencing, abi-solid, ion torrent, 454, illumina, assembeled, other

lib_size.description: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

amp_polymerase.description: The polymerase used for amplification. Compare to tail_polymerase. Also could be RT PCR if rRNA was isolated from specimen.

Tris_HCl_final_conc.description: Tris-HCl final concentration expressed in millimolar

pcr_replicates.description: Replicate PCR reactiond that are pooled

forward_barcodes.description: List of barcodes attached to forward primers

MgCl2_final_conc.description: MgCl2 final concentration expressed in millimolar

cycle_annealing_method.description: Cycle annealing method. Use one of: static, touchdown, gradient, other

lib_reads_seqd.description: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

target_gene.description: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies; e.g. 16S rRNA, 18S rRNA, nif, amoA, rpo

reverse_primers.description: List of reverse PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment

forward_primers.description: List of forward PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment

adapters.description: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

other_additives.description: Any other PCR additive that is not listed here

pcr_volume.description: PCR buffer volume expressed in microliters

tail_duration.description: Incubation time for tailing reaction in seconds

domain.description: Archaea , Bacteria , Eukarya - requiered by VAMPS

run_number.description: Samples were sequenced in multiple pools with non-unique barcodes

sample_name.description: Unique name or id of the sample the library is derived from

reverse_barcodes.description: List of barcodes attached to reverse primers

gelatin_final_conc.description: Gelatin final concentration expressed in percent

local_NAP_ids.description: A list of nucleic acid prep ids processed in this batch. This is the ID attached to the tube containing the purified nucleic acids

metagenome_id.description: MG-RAST metagenome ID for sequences in this library

target_subfragment.description: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus; e.g. V6, V9, ITS

tail_polymerase.description: The polymerase used in tailing reaction

pcr_clean_up_methods.description: One or more can be listed. Ex: column, gel, precipitation, size exclusion filtration

metagenome_name.description: Unique name for the sequences from this library

reverse_primer_final_conc.description: Reverse primer final concentration in micromolar

nucl_acid_ext.description: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP)

seq_url.description: URL of instatute sequencing was done

lib_vector.description: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

NAP_volume.description: A list of volumes of nucleic acid preps used for PCR in this batch. Expressed in microliters

nucl_acid_amp.description: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP)

lib_screen.description: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries

file_name.description: Name of the sequence file submitted to MG-RAST

tail_temp.description: Incubation temperature for tailing reaction in celsius

cycle_annealing_temp.description: Cycle annealing temperature in celsius. May be one or more values

file_checksum.description: MD5 checksum of the sequence file submitted to MG-RAST

investigation_type.description: Library construction type. This field is either metagenome for whole genome shotgun sequencing or mimarks-survey for amplicon/target gene (eg. 16S) sequencing. Use one of: metagenome, mimarks-survey.

misc_param.description: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

KCl_final_conc.description: KCl final concentration expressed in millimolar

BSA_final_conc.description: Final BSA concentration expressed in milligram / milliliter

library_institute.description: Name of institute creating the library

seq_center.description: Name of instatute sequencing was done

seq_quality_check.description: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms).

seq_direction.description: Sequencing direction, valid terms are forward, reverse, both - requied by VAMPS

lib_const_meth.description: Library construction method used for clone libraries

lib_vector.description: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

misc_param.description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

nucl_acid_amp.description: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP)

seq_meth.description: Sequencing method used. Use one of: sanger, pyrosequencing, abi-solid, ion torrent, 454, illumina, assembeled, other

lib_size.description: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

lib_type.description: Type of library used. For 454 only

lib_screen.description: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries

file_name.description: Name of the sequence file submitted to MG-RAST

sample_name.description: Unique name or id of the sample the library is derived from

assembly.description: How was the assembly done (e.g. with a text based assembler like phrap or a flowgram assembler); estimated error rate associated with the finished sequences (e.g. error rate of 1 in 1000 bp); and the method of calculation

metagenome_id.description: MG-RAST metagenome ID for sequences in this library

lib_reads_seqd.description: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

assembly_name.description: Name/version of the assembly provided by the submitter that is used in the genome browsers and in the community

seq_center.description: Name of instatute sequencing was done

seq_quality_check.description: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms).

metagenome_name.description: Unique name for the sequences from this library

454_regions.description: Number of regions used. For 454 only

file_checksum.description: MD5 checksum of the sequence file submitted to MG-RAST

lib_const_meth.description: Library construction method used for clone libraries

adapters.description: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

nucl_acid_ext.description: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP)

investigation_type.description: Library construction type. This field is either metagenome for whole genome shotgun sequencing or mimarks-survey for amplicon/target gene (eg. 16S) sequencing. Use one of: metagenome, mimarks-survey.

seq_url.description: URL of instatute sequencing was done

lib_vector.description: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

rrna_removal_meth.description: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP) describing the method for removal of rRNA from total RNA

seq_meth.description: Sequencing method used. Use one of: sanger, pyrosequencing, abi-solid, ion torrent, 454, illumina, assembeled, other

lib_size.description: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

cdna_purif_meth.description: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP) describing the method for removal of trace RNA contaminants from cDNA

lib_screen.description: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries

file_name.description: Name of the sequence file submitted to MG-RAST

cdna_ampf_meth.description: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP) describing the method for amplifying the cDNA to boost the amount of material available for sequencing

lib_reads_seqd.description: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

file_checksum.description: MD5 checksum of the sequence file submitted to MG-RAST

investigation_type.description: Library construction type. This field is either metagenome for whole genome shotgun sequencing or mimarks-survey for amplicon/target gene (eg. 16S) sequencing. Use one of: metagenome, mimarks-survey.

misc_param.description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

rev_trans_meth.description: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP) describing the method for reverse transcription, including the enzyme name, method and details of primers

lib_type.description: Type of library used. For 454 only

sample_name.description: Unique name or id of the sample the library is derived from

metagenome_id.description: MG-RAST metagenome ID for sequences in this library

samp_isol_dur.description: The length of time taken to isolate the physical sample, for example time between obtaining the sample, filtration steps and finally snap freezing

mrna_percent.description: mRNA as a percentage of total RNA after rRNA removal

seq_quality_check.description: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms).

seq_center.description: Name of instatute sequencing was done

metagenome_name.description: Unique name for the sequences from this library

454_regions.description: Number of regions used. For 454 only

lib_const_meth.description: Library construction method used for clone libraries

seq_url.description: URL of instatute sequencing was done

mechanical_damage.description: information about any mechanical damage exerted on the plant; can include multiple damages and sites

samp_salinity.description: salinity of sample, i.e. measure of total salt concentration

herbicide_regm.description: information about treatment involving use of herbicides; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of herbicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens

climate_environment.description: treatment involving an exposure to a particular climate; can include multiple climates

rainfall_regm.description: information about treatment involving an exposure to a given amount of rainfall; can include multiple regimens

tot_mass.description: total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host

fertilizer_regm.description: information about treatment involving the use of fertilizers; should include the name fertilizer, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fertilizer regimens

organism_count.description: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample,should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

fungicide_regm.description: information about treatment involving use of fungicides; should include the name of fungicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fungicide regimens

watering_regm.description: information about treatment involving an exposure to watering frequencies; can include multiple regimens

salt_regm.description: information about treatment involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media; should include the name of salt, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple salt regimens

chem_administration.description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v1.72), please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44603

standing_water_regm.description: treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water; can include multiple regimens

life_stage.description: description of life stage of host

humidity_regm.description: information about treatment involving an exposure to varying degree of humidity; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include amount of humidity administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens

samp_store_loc.description: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

radiation_regm.description: information about treatment involving exposure of plant or a plant part to a particular radiation regimen; should include the radiation type, amount or intensity administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple radiation regimens

perturbation.description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

disease_stat.description: list of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. the value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from DO (Disease Ontology), other hosts are free text. For DO terms, please see http://gemina.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/gemina/trunk/Gemina/ontologies/gemina_symptom.obo?view=log

samp_store_dur.description: duration for which sample was stored

plant_product.description: substance produced by the plant, where the sample was obtained from

chem_mutagen.description: treatment involving use of mutagens; should include the name of mutagen, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mutagen regimens

gravity.description: information about treatment involving use of gravity factor to study various types of responses in presence, absence or modified levels of gravity; can include multiple treatments

non_mineral_nutr_regm.description: information about treatment involving the exposure of plant to non-mineral nutrient such as oxygen, hydrogen or carbon; should include the name of non-mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple non-mineral nutrient regimens

host_taxid.description: NCBI taxon id of the host, e.g. 9606

body_product.description: substance produced by the plant where the sample was obtained from

tiss_cult_growth_med.description: description of plant tissue culture growth media used

misc_param.description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

plant_body_site.description: name of body site that the sample was obtained from. For PO (v819) terms please see, http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/42737

age.description: age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees

pesticide_regm.description: information about treatment involving use of insecticides; should include the name of pesticide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple pesticide regimens

samp_store_temp.description: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

antibiotic_regm.description: information about treatment involving antibiotic administration; should include the name of antibiotic, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple antibiotic regimens

growth_hormone_regm.description: information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of growth hormone, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple growth hormone regimens

ph_regm.description: information about treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of pH of the growth media; can include multiple regimen

growth_med.description: information about growth media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples

sample_name.description: Unique name or id of the sample the library is derived from

mineral_nutr_regm.description: information about treatment involving the use of mineral supplements; should include the name of mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mineral nutrient regimens

host_common_name.description: common name of the host, e.g. human

infra_specific_rank.description: taxonomic rank information about the host below subspecies level, such as variety, form, rank etc.

gaseous_environment.description: use of conditions with differing gaseous environments; should include the name of gaseous compound, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple gaseous environment regimens

water_temp_regm.description: information about treatment involving an exposure to water with varying degree of temperature; can include multiple regimens

air_temp_regm.description: information about treatment involving an exposure to varying temperatures; should include the temperature, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include different temperature regimens

phenotype.description: phenotype of host. For Phenotypic quality Ontology (PATO) (v1.269) terms, please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44601

infra_specific_name.description: taxonomic information about the host below subspecies level

season_environment.description: treatment involving an exposure to a particular season (e.g. winter, summer, rabi, rainy etc.)

n_alkanes.description: concentration of n-alkanes; can include multiple n-alkanes

pressure.description: pressure to which the sample is subject, in atmospheres

organism_count.description: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample,should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

chem_administration.description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v1.72), please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44603

methane.description: methane (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

carb_nitro_ratio.description: ratio of amount or concentrations of carbon to nitrogen

samp_store_loc.description: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

mean_peak_frict_vel.description: measurement of mean peak friction velocity

tot_org_carb.description: Definition for soil: total organic C content of the soil units of g C/kg soil. Definition otherwise: total organic carbon content

particle_class.description: particles are classified, based on their size, into six general categories:clay, silt, sand, gravel, cobbles, and boulders; should include amount of particle preceded by the name of the particle type; can include multiple values

biomass.description: amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g. microbial, total. can include multiple measurements

phaeopigments.description: concentration of phaeopigments; can include multiple phaeopigments

porosity.description: porosity of deposited sediment is volume of voids divided by the total volume of sample

tot_nitro.description: total nitrogen concentration, calculated by: total nitrogen = total dissolved nitrogen + particulate nitrogen. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as nitrogen

phosplipid_fatt_acid.description: concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values

perturbation.description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

diether_lipids.description: concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids

samp_store_dur.description: duration for which sample was stored

redox_potential.description: redox potential, measured relative to a hydrogen cell, indicating oxidation or reduction potential

misc_param.description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

samp_store_temp.description: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

sediment_type.description: information about the sediment type based on major constituents

sample_name.description: Unique name or id of the sample the library is derived from

diss_org_nitro.description: dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2

alkalinity.description: alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate

samp_salinity.description: salinity of sample, i.e. measure of total salt concentration

tot_mass.description: total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host

birth_control.description: specification of birth control medication used

organism_count.description: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample,should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

body_site.description: name of body site where the sample was obtained from. For Foundational Model of Anatomy Ontology (FMA) (v3.1) terms, please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44507

body_mass_index.description: body mass index, calculated as weight/(height)squared

chem_administration.description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v1.72), please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44603

gynecologic_disord.description: history of gynecological disorders; can include multiple disorders

diet.description: type of diet depending on the host, for animals omnivore, herbivore etc., for humans high-fat, meditteranean etc.; can include multiple diet types

samp_store_loc.description: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

occupation.description: most frequent job performed by subject

family_relationship.description: relationships to other hosts in the same study; can include multiple relationships

perturbation.description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

hrt.description: whether subject had hormone replacement theraphy, and if yes start date

disease_stat.description: list of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. the value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from DO (Disease Ontology), other hosts are free text. For DO terms, please see http://gemina.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/gemina/trunk/Gemina/ontologies/gemina_symptom.obo?view=log

host_body_temp.description: core body temperature of the host when sample was collected

samp_store_dur.description: duration for which sample was stored

pulse.description: resting pulse, measured as beats per minute

body_product.description: substance produced by the body, e.g. stool, mucus, where the sample was obtained from. For Foundational Model of Anatomy Ontology (FMA) (v3.1) terms, please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44507

misc_param.description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

sexual_act.description: current sexual partner and frequency of sex

medic_hist_perform.description: whether full medical history was collected

age.description: age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees

samp_store_temp.description: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

last_meal.description: content of last meal and time since feeding; can include multiple values

sample_name.description: Unique name or id of the sample the library is derived from

urogenit_disord.description: history of urogenital disorders, can include multiple disorders

host_subject_id.description: a unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #131

phenotype.description: phenotype of host. For Phenotypic quality Ontology (PATO) (v1.269) terms, please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44601

hysterectomy.description: specification of whether hysterectomy was performed

al_sat_meth.description: reference or method used in determining Al saturation

tot_n.description: total nitrogen content of the soil Units of g N/kg soil

profile_position.description: cross-sectional position in the hillslope where sample was collected.sample area position in relation to surrounding areas

sieving.description: collection design of pooled samples and/or sieve size and amount of sample sieved

heavy_metals_meth.description: reference or method used in determining heavy metals

flooding.description: historical and/or physical evidence of flooding

heavy_metals.description: heavy metals present and concentrationsany drug used by subject and the frequency of usage; can include multiple heavy metals and concentrations

tot_org_c_meth.description: reference or method used in determining total organic C

tot_org_carb.description: Definition for soil: total organic C content of the soil units of g C/kg soil. Definition otherwise: total organic carbon content

drainage_class.description: drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system

horizon.description: specific layer in the land area which measures parallel to the soil surface and possesses physical characteristics which differ from the layers above and beneath

texture_meth.description: reference or method used in determining soil texture

pool_dna_extracts.description: were multiple DNA extractions mixed? how many?

agrochem_addition.description: addition of fertilizers, pesticides, etc. - amount and time of applications

soil_type.description: soil series name or other lower-level classification

previous_land_use_meth.description: reference or method used in determining previous land use and dates

soil_type_meth.description: reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification

slope_gradient.description: commonly called ___slope.__�  The angle between ground surface and a horizontal line (in percent).  This is the direction that overland water would flow.  This measure is usually taken with a hand level meter or clinometer.

water_content_soil_meth.description: reference or method used in determining the water content of soil

salinity_meth.description: reference or method used in determining salinity

ph_meth.description: reference or method used in determining pH

misc_param.description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

local_class_meth.description: reference or method used in determining the local soil classification

tot_n_meth.description: reference or method used in determining the total N

texture.description: the relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil, as described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g., silty clay loam) optional.

horizon_meth.description: reference or method used in determining the horizon

fao_class.description: soil classification from the FAO World Reference Database for Soil Resources

cur_vegetation_meth.description: reference or method used in vegetation classification

fire.description: historical and/or physical evidence of fire

store_cond.description: explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before DNA extraction.

sample_name.description: Unique name or id of the sample the library is derived from

local_class.description: soil classification based on local soil classification system

microbial_biomass.description: the part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 _�m. IF you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units, which should be mg C (or N)/kg soil).

crop_rotation.description: whether or not crop is rotated, and if yes, rotation schedule

link_class_info.description: link to digitized soil maps or other soil classification information

extreme_event.description: unusual physical events that may have affected microbial populations

slope_aspect.description: the direction a slope faces. While looking down a slope use a compass to record the direction you are facing (direction or degrees); e.g., NW or 315_�.  This measure provides an indication of sun and wind exposure that will influence soil temperature and evapotranspiration.

microbial_biomass_meth.description: reference or method used in determining microbial biomass

cur_vegetation.description: vegetation classification from one or more standard classification systems, or agricultural crop

n_alkanes.description: concentration of n-alkanes; can include multiple n-alkanes

pressure.description: pressure to which the sample is subject, in atmospheres

samp_store_loc.description: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

perturbation.description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

diether_lipids.description: concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids

redox_potential.description: redox potential, measured relative to a hydrogen cell, indicating oxidation or reduction potential

samp_store_temp.description: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

tot_depth_water_col.description: measurement of total depth of water column

sample_name.description: Unique name or id of the sample the library is derived from

diss_org_nitro.description: dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2

alkalinity.description: alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate

atmospheric_data.description: measurement of atmospheric data; can include multiple data

organism_count.description: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample,should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

chem_administration.description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v1.72), please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44603

carb_nitro_ratio.description: ratio of amount or concentrations of carbon to nitrogen

mean_peak_frict_vel.description: measurement of mean peak friction velocity

biomass.description: amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g. microbial, total. can include multiple measurements

phaeopigments.description: concentration of phaeopigments; can include multiple phaeopigments

tot_nitro.description: total nitrogen concentration, calculated by: total nitrogen = total dissolved nitrogen + particulate nitrogen. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as nitrogen

phosplipid_fatt_acid.description: concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values

samp_store_dur.description: duration for which sample was stored

misc_param.description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

tot_diss_nitro.description: total dissolved nitrogen concentration, reported as nitrogen, measured by: total dissolved nitrogen = NH4 + NO3NO2 + dissolved organic nitrogen

tot_phosp.description: total phosphorus concentration, calculated by: total phosphorus = total dissolved phosphorus + particulate phosphorus. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as phosphorus

soluble_org_mat.description: concentration of substances such as urea, fruit sugars, soluble proteins, drugs, pharmaceuticals, etc.

samp_salinity.description: salinity of sample, i.e. measure of total salt concentration

pre_treatment.description: the process of pre-treatment removes materials that can be easily collected from the raw wastewater

biochem_oxygen_dem.description: a measure of the relative oxygen-depletion effect of a waste contaminant

organism_count.description: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample,should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

efficiency_percent.description: percentage of volatile solids removed from the anaerobic digestor

chem_administration.description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v1.72), please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44603

samp_store_loc.description: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

sewage_type.description: type of wastewater treatment plant as municipial or industrial

soluble_inorg_mat.description: concentration of substances such as ammonia, road-salt, sea-salt, cyanide, hydrogen sulfide, thiocyanates, thiosulfates, etc.

sludge_retent_time.description: the time activated sludge remains in reactor

org_particles.description: concentration of particles such as faeces, hairs, food, vomit, paper fibers, plant material, humus, etc.

chem_oxygen_dem.description: a measure of the relative oxygen-depletion effect of a waste contaminant

tot_nitro.description: total nitrogen concentration, calculated by: total nitrogen = total dissolved nitrogen + particulate nitrogen. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as nitrogen

perturbation.description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

reactor_type.description: anaerobic digesters can be designed and engineered to operate using a number of different process configurations, as batch or continuous, mesophilic, high solid or low solid, and single stage or multistage

samp_store_dur.description: duration for which sample was stored

emulsions.description: amount or concentration of substances such as paints, adhesives, mayonnaise, hair colorants, emulsified oils, etc.; can include multiple emulsion types

misc_param.description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

tot_phosphate.description: total amount or concentration of phosphate

primary_treatment.description: the process to produce both a generally homogeneous liquid capable of being treated biologically and a sludge that can be separately treated or processed

samp_store_temp.description: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

sample_name.description: Unique name or id of the sample the library is derived from

gaseous_substances.description: amount or concentration of substances such as hydrogen sulfide, carbon dioxide, methane, etc.; can include multiple substances

tertiary_treatment.description: the process providing a final treatment stage to raise the effluent quality before it is discharged to the receiving environment

wastewater_type.description: the origin of wastewater such as human waste, rainfall, storm drains, etc.

indust_eff_percent.description: percentage of industrial effluents received by wastewater treatment plant

alkalinity.description: alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate

suspend_solids.description: concentration of substances including a wide variety of material, such as silt, decaying plant and animal matter, etc,; can include multiple substances

inorg_particles.description: concentration of particles such as sand, grit, metal particles, ceramics, etc.; can include multiple particles

secondary_treatment.description: the process for substantially degrading the biological content of the sewage

time_since_last_wash.description: specification of the time since last wash

occupation.description: most frequent job performed by subject

family_relationship.description: relationships to other hosts in the same study; can include multiple relationships

pulse.description: resting pulse, measured as beats per minute

abs_air_humidity.description: actual mass of water vapor - mh20 - present in the air water vapor mixture.

misc_param.description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

build_occup_type.description: The primary function for which a building or discrete part of a building is intended to be used

occup_samp.description: number of occupants present at time of sample within the given space

typ_occupant_dens.description: customary or normal density of occupants

organism_count.description: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample,should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

indoor_space.description: A distinguishable space within a structure, The purpose for which discrete areas of a building is used

sample_name.description: Unique name or id of the sample the library is derived from

rel_air_humidity.description: partial vapor and air pressure, density of the vapor and air, or by the actual mass of the vapor and air.

heat_cool_type.description: methods of conditioning or heating a room or building

light_type.description: Application of light to achieve some practical or aesthetic effect. Lighting includes the use of both artificial light sources such as lamps and light fixtures, as well as natural illumination by capturing daylight. Can also include absence of light.

building_setting.description: A location (geography) where a building is set

filter_type.description: A device which removes solid particulates or  airborne molecular contaminants,

carb_dioxide.description: carbon dioxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

surf_humidity.description: surfaces: water activity as a function of air and material moisture

occupant_dens_samp.description: average number of occupants at time of sampling per square footage

surf_temp.description: temperature of the surface at the time of sampling

dew_point.description: the temperature to which a given parcel of humid air must be cooled, at constant barometric pressure, for water vapor to condense into water.

surf_material.description: surface materials at the point of sampling

substructure_type.description: The substructure or under building is that largely hidden section of the building which is built off the foundations to the ground floor level

air_temp.description: temperature of the air at the time of sampling

samp_sort_meth.description: method by which samples are sorted

ventilation_type.description: the intentional movement of air from outside a building to the inside through forced or natural movement of air.

space_typ_state.description: customary or normal state of the space

nose_throat_disord.description: history of nose-throat disorders; can include multiple disorders

study_complt_stat.description: specification of study completion status, if no the reason should be specified

foetal_health_stat.description: specification of foetal health status, should also include abortion

body_site.description: name of body site where the sample was obtained from. For Foundational Model of Anatomy Ontology (FMA) (v3.1) terms, please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44507

body_mass_index.description: body mass index, calculated as weight/(height)squared

chem_administration.description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v1.72), please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44603

diet.description: type of diet depending on the host, for animals omnivore, herbivore etc., for humans high-fat, meditteranean etc.; can include multiple diet types

sample_name.description: Unique name or id of the sample the library is derived from

samp_store_loc.description: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

occupation.description: most frequent job performed by subject

host_subject_id.description: a unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #131

family_relationship.description: relationships to other hosts in the same study; can include multiple relationships

perturbation.description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

disease_stat.description: list of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. the value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from DO (Disease Ontology), other hosts are free text. For DO terms, please see http://gemina.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/gemina/trunk/Gemina/ontologies/gemina_symptom.obo?view=log

host_body_temp.description: core body temperature of the host when sample was collected

phenotype.description: phenotype of host. For Phenotypic quality Ontology (PATO) (v1.269) terms, please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44601

samp_store_dur.description: duration for which sample was stored

pulse.description: resting pulse, measured as beats per minute

body_product.description: substance produced by the body, e.g. stool, mucus, where the sample was obtained from. For Foundational Model of Anatomy Ontology (FMA) (v3.1) terms, please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44507

wind_direction.description: wind direction is the direction from which a wind originates

ventilation_rate.description: ventilation rate of the system in the sampled premises

samp_salinity.description: salinity of sample, i.e. measure of total salt concentration

misc_param.description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

solar_irradiance.description: the amount of solar energy that arrives at a specific area of a surface during a specific time interval

oxygen.description: oxygen (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

organism_count.description: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample,should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

samp_store_temp.description: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

chem_administration.description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v1.72), please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44603

sample_name.description: Unique name or id of the sample the library is derived from

carb_monoxide.description: carbon monoxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

methane.description: methane (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

humidity.description: amount of water vapour in the air, at the time of sampling

volatile_org_comp.description: concentration of carbon-based chemicals that easily evaporate at room temperature; can report multiple volatile organic compounds by entering numeric values preceded by name of compound

samp_store_loc.description: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

carb_dioxide.description: carbon dioxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

pollutants.description: pollutant types and, amount or concentrations measured at the time of sampling; can report multiple pollutants by entering numeric values preceded by name of pollutant

perturbation.description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

ventilation_type.description: ventilation system used in the sampled premises

barometric_press.description: force per unit area exerted against a surface by the weight of air above that surface

resp_part_matter.description: concentration of substances that remain suspended in the air, and comprise mixtures of organic and inorganic substances (PM10 and PM2.5); can report multiple PM's by entering numeric values preceded by name of PM

wind_speed.description: speed of wind measured at the time of sampling

samp_store_dur.description: duration for which sample was stored
